game: "Fivalath" (players 2) (equipment { (board (square <Board:size>) use:Vertex) (piece "Ball" Each) }) (rules (play (move Add (to (sites Empty)))) (end { (if (is Line 5 All) (result Mover Win)) (if (is Line 4 All) (result Mover Loss)) }) )
metadata: (info { (description "Fivalath is a game invented by Néstor Romeral Andrés in 2020 that was inspired by Yavalath. Players must make a line of five of their pieces to win, but will lose if they make a line of 4 first.") (rules "Played on a square grid (8x8 or larger) with two players. Players alternate placing one stone of their colour on the board on any empty point. If a player makes a line of five pieces, either orthogonally or diagonally, they win; but if they make a line of four pieces, they lose.") (id "1400") (source "<a href=\"https: (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/space/line") (author "Néstor Romeral Andrés") (credit "Eric Silverman") (date "2020") } ) (graphics { (player Colour P1 (colour Black)) (player Colour P2 (colour White)) (board Style Go) }) (ai "Fivalath_ai" )
